page.title: 08LEASIDE WALK
page.content: The river Lea is not straight and not deep. Some of the grass is cut and some is not. In the long grass are trees including silverbirch, very big weeping willows and elderberry. There is a little ditch, a bridge and stinging nettles. In the river are frogs, fish and water moles. We also saw a copse (little wood). In the park there is a sports ground used for racing, hockey, cricket and it has ten terraces. There is also a big rectangular garden, a rose garden, a rock garden, and a shrub garden. There are apple trees, pink, purple, red, white and yellow petunias. The path we walk along is made of bark chippings and a style leads us back to the side walk.
